item.title: An Introduction to Heart Rate Variability
item.description: Back when I was a school boy, after a bout of running in the sports hall, our teacher told us to feel for our pulse and count each beat while he timed us. We then rested for a couple of minutes and counted again. The second count was obviously lower as my heart rate had slowed while resting between the first and second measurements. This was a very simple test which only required a stopwatch while we counted the beats of our pulse.
